given.$comment: Metadata about the given name field.

middle.$comment: The person's middle names, possibly separated into an array of words. eg. ["Maria", "Theresa", "Catherine"]

family.$comment: The person's family name, possibly separated into an array of words. eg. ["van", "der", "Molen"]

familyPhonetic.$comment: The person's family name given phonetically, often used for sorting purposes.

prefix.$comment: Any prefixes to the person's name.

suffix.$comment: Any suffixes to the person's given name.

gender.$comment: The gender of the person, if known and required to format the name properly.

formats.$comment: List of formats commonly used in this locale in various politeness levels and styles.

short.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is the honorifics and the family name.

long.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is the honorifics, given, and family names.

short.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is only the given name and a short family name.

medium.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is only the given name, middle names, and a short family name.

long.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is only honorifics, prefixes, given name, middle names, and the family name.

full.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale.  Typically, this is all the available parts of a person's name.

short.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is only the given name, though in some locales it is the family name.

long.$comment: Order and spacing for a short version of a person's name in this locale. Typically, this is only given name, middle names, and a family name.

sortByHeadWord.$comment: Whether or not this locale sorts family names by the head word (true) or the auxillary words (false).

conjunctions.$comment: list of conjunction and disjunction words for names of multiple people or families

auxillaries.$comment: List of auxillary words to the family names commonly used in this locale.

honorifics.$comment: List of prefixes or suffixes that are used as honorific terms, such as 'Mr.' or '-san'.

prefixes.$comment: List of non-honorific prefixes commonly used in this locale

suffixes.$comment: List of non-honorific sufixes commonly used in this locale
